cliInfo.description: Interact with your Koyeb resources without leaving the terminal
cliInfo.install: Don't have Koyeb CLI installed yet? <link>Check out the installation instruction</link>

deployToKoyebButton.title: Deploy to Koyeb button
deployToKoyebButton.tooltip: The "Deploy to Koyeb" button allows you to deploy applications from a GitHub repository or Docker image with a single click. It offers a fast deployment option to share your services with your team and users.

accountLocked.title: We cannot offer you access to Koyeb
accountLocked.line1: Your account matches patterns often associated with violations of our <terms>Terms of Service</terms>
accountLocked.line2: While we cannot provide details about the reason(s) triggering this behavior, we have determined that providing access to Koyeb is not possible
accountLocked.line3: If you believe this is a bug, you can <link>verify your identity</link>

unhandledError.title: Whoops!
unhandledError.statusLink: If this keeps happening, check out <link>status.koyeb.com</link>.

regions.label: Deploy in regions
regions.noRegionSelected: Please select at least one region

upgradeDialog.title: Add credit card

requestQuotaIncreaseDialog.title: Quota increase request
requestQuotaIncreaseDialog.line1: It looks like you're ready to deploy on a {instance} instance, but we'll need to increase your organization quota first.
requestQuotaIncreaseDialog.line2: Let's <link>chat</link> to learn more about your needs and get started.

organizationNameField.startEndAlphanumeric: Start and end with an alphanumeric symbol

upgradeDialog.temporaryHoldMessage: A temporary hold of USD $1 will be placed on the card and then refunded immediately

upgradeDialog.paymentMethodTimeoutTitle: We could not register your payment method
upgradeDialog.paymentMethodTimeoutDescription: Please try again later or {contactUs} if the problem persists

serviceEstimatedCost.title: Estimated Cost
serviceEstimatedCost.descriptionFreeInstance: Below is the estimated cost based on your current service configuration
serviceEstimatedCost.descriptionFixedScaling: Below is the estimated cost based on your current service configuration. Resources are billed by the second.
serviceEstimatedCost.descriptionScaling: Below are the minimum and maximum estimated costs based on your current service configuration. Resources are billed by the second.
serviceEstimatedCost.regionDescriptionFixedScaling: You will have {instanceCount} {instanceName} {instanceCount, plural, =1 {instance} other {instances}} running per region
serviceEstimatedCost.regionDescriptionScaling: You will have between {minInstanceCount} and {maxInstanceCount} {instanceName} {maxInstanceCount, plural, =1 {instance} other {instances}} running per region

deleteAccount.label: Delete account
deleteAccount.description: Once this operation is performed, your account will be permanently deleted
deleteAccount.mustLeaveOrganizations: You must leave or delete all your organizations before you can delete your account

confirmationDialog.title: Delete account
confirmationDialog.description: Your user account will be deleted. Are you sure?

deactivateOrganization.title: Deactivate the organization
deactivateOrganization.description: When you deactivate an organization, all associated resources will be deleted: Apps, Services, Secrets, Domains, GitHub app and API credentials. You can reactivate an organization at any time.
deactivateOrganization.deactivationRequestSuccessNotification: We've sent you an email to confirm the deactivation of your organization

reactivateOrganization.title: Reactivate the organization
reactivateOrganization.description: Activate the organization to start using this Koyeb organization again.

deleteOrganization.title: Delete the organization
deleteOrganization.description: Permanently delete the organization and the associated payment information
deleteOrganization.hasUnpaidInvoices: Your organization has unpaid invoices. Settle the outstanding payment to be able to delete the organization.
deleteOrganization.mustBeDeactivated: The organization must first be deactivated before it can be deleted

createServiceDialog.webServiceDescription: A web service accessible from the Internet and the service mesh
createServiceDialog.workerDescription: Runs in the background and is not internet accessible
createServiceDialog.githubDescription: Connect, build and deploy your code from a GitHub repository
createServiceDialog.dockerDescription: Deploy docker images from any public or private registries
createServiceDialog.invalidGithubRepositoryUrl: Please provide a GitHub repository URL
createServiceDialog.githubAppLinks: Missing Git repository? <resynchronizeLink>Re-synchronize</resynchronizeLink> repositories or <githubAppLink>edit GitHub app permissions</githubAppLink>.

upgradeDialog.title: Upgrade plan
upgradeDialog.description: The current selected instance is available on the {plan} plan at $0/mo. Add a payment method to upgrade and deploy.

buildFailed.title: An error occurred while building your application

cause.before: Different reasons can result in a build failure. The most common ones are:
cause.reason1: The language or package manager used by your application is not supported
cause.reason2: Your application is missing required dependencies
cause.reason3: An invalid configuration results in an error during the build process

solution.line1: First, make sure that your application builds properly on your machine. Build logs also provide useful information to help you identify and resolve the root cause. Read our troubleshooting <link>documentation</link> to view and resolve common errors.
solution.line2: Check the build logs for more details.

runtimeFailed.title: An error occurred while deploying your application

cause.before: Different reasons can result in a deployment failure. The most common ones are:
cause.reason1: The command to launch your application is not defined
cause.reason2: Your application failed to pass the the initial health checks
cause.reason3: The selected Instance type doesn't have enough resource to properly run your application

solution.line1: First, make sure that your application runs properly on your machine. Deployment logs also provide useful information to help you identify and resolve the root cause. Read our troubleshooting <link>documentation</link> to view and resolve common errors.
solution.line2: Check the deployment logs for more details.

build.title: Build
build.buildSkipped: This deployment uses a previous build originally created during deployment <link>{deploymentId}</link>

waitingForLogs.title: Getting ready to build your service

simpleSecretForm.title: Create secret
simpleSecretForm.description: All Secret values are automatically encrypted server-side to ensure secure storage

registrySecretForm.title: Create registry credential

worker.title: Create worker service

model.title: Create inference model service

github.missingRepositoryLink: Missing a GitHub repository? <link>Edit GitHub app permissions</link>

noRepository.title: No repositories found
noRepository.description: This can happen when Koyeb doesn't have access to the repositories in your organization.
noRepository.searchEmptyResults: Your search for "{search}" did not return any results.

publicRepository.title: Public GitHub repository
publicRepository.description: Use a public repository by entering the URL below. Features like auto-deploy are not available when using a public repository.

awsRegions.tooltip: If you need to leverage AWS ecosystem and reduce data transfer costs

alerts.freeMessage: The Free instance can be deployed in {fra} or {was} and doesn't support scaling. Select another instance to access more features and regions.

review.title: Create a new service
review.description: Go with the recommended settings or adjust them according to your needs

tips.title: Did you know?
tips.fallback: Koyeb natively supports real-time protocols, including WebSocket, gRPC, and HTTP/2

initialDeployment.description: Follow the steps to track the creation process or <link>manage your service</link>

deploymentQueued.details: Your deployment is queued and will start in a few seconds

deploymentQueuedLong.title: Deployment queued

deploymentScheduledLong.reportSuccessNotification: The team has been notified and will investigate

serviceReady.title: Your service is ready

nextSteps.title: Your service is ready
nextSteps.description: Your just deployed a new service to Koyeb. Check out the next steps.

serviceForm.gpuAlert: Serverless GPUs are available in public preview. <cta>Get started now</cta>.

notEnoughVRam.title: Model too large for selected GPU
notEnoughVRam.description: The selected GPU might not provide enough VRAM to run the model. We recommend choosing another GPU with at least {min} of VRAM.

noBestFit.title: Model too large for the listed GPUs
noBestFit.description: The model might be too large for the GPUs we offer. You can still try to deploy the model.

withBuild.label: With build
withBuild.description: Recommended if your changes alter the build process

withoutBuild.label: Without rebuild
withoutBuild.description: Recommended if changes do not affect the build process

serviceType.workerDescription: Runs in the background and is not internet accessible

source.archiveSourceTooltip: Build and deploy your code using the koyeb deploy or koyeb archive command
source.githubSourceTooltip: Connect, build and deploy your code from a GitHub repository
source.dockerSourceTooltip: Deploy Docker images from any public or private registries

archive.title: Archive
archive.description: Your service is managed using the koyeb deploy or koyeb archive command
archive.documentationLink: Learn more about deploying a directory

git.repositoryTooltip: Choose the repository you want to deploy on Koyeb
git.publicRepositoryTooltip: Use a public repository by entering the URL below. Features like auto-deploy are not available when using a public repository.
git.branchTooltip: Select the repository branch you want to deploy on Koyeb
git.autoDeployTooltip: When enabled, every time an update is made to this branch, your application will be re-deployed
git.githubAppLinks: Missing Git repository? <resynchronizeLink>Re-synchronize</resynchronizeLink> repositories or edit <githubAppLink>GitHub app permissions</githubAppLink>.

installGithubApp.title: GitHub app not installed
installGithubApp.description: You haven't connected any GitHub account to Koyeb. To continue deployment using the repository, install the application.
installGithubApp.requested: An admin of your GitHub organization must approve the request to complete the installation

docker.imageTooltip: Add the url of the Docker image you want to deploy on Koyeb
docker.registrySecretTooltip: If your image is private, create or select the registry configuration secret to allow Koyeb to pull your image

builder.buildpackDescription: Uses buildpacks to detect your project's language, install dependencies, and package the environment into a runnable image
builder.dockerfileDescription: If your repository contains a Dockerfile, Koyeb can use it to build a runnable container image for your project

buildpackConfiguration.title: Configure Buildpack
buildpackConfiguration.description: Customize Buildpack configuration to meet the needs of your repository
buildpackConfiguration.buildCommandTooltip: The command to build your application during the build phase. If your application does not require a build command, leave this field empty.
buildpackConfiguration.runCommandTooltip: The command to run your application once the build is completed
buildpackConfiguration.workDirectoryTooltip: The directory where your source code is located. If not set, the work directory defaults to the root of the repository.
buildpackConfiguration.privilegedTooltip: When enabled, the service container will run in privileged mode. This advanced feature is useful to get advanced system privileges, for example to start a docker daemon.

dockerfileConfiguration.title: Configure Dockerfile
dockerfileConfiguration.description: Customize Dockerfile configuration to meet the needs of your repository
dockerfileConfiguration.dockerfileLocationTooltip: The location of your Dockerfile relative to the work directory. If not set, the work directory defaults to the root of the repository.
dockerfileConfiguration.entrypointTooltip: Override the default entrypoint to execute on the container
dockerfileConfiguration.commandTooltip: Override the command to execute on the container. To pass build-time variables similar to the ARG instruction, use environment variables.
dockerfileConfiguration.targetTooltip: Target build stage: If your Dockerfile contains multi-stage builds, you can choose the target stage to build and deploy by entering its name
dockerfileConfiguration.workDirectoryTooltip: The directory where your source code is located. If not set, the work directory defaults to the root of the repository.
dockerfileConfiguration.privilegedTooltip: When enabled, the service container will run in privileged mode. This advanced feature is useful to get advanced system privileges, for example to start a docker daemon.

deployment.entrypointTooltip: Override the default entrypoint to execute on the container
deployment.commandTooltip: Override the command to execute on the container
deployment.privilegedTooltip: When enabled, the service container will run in privileged mode. This advanced feature is useful to get advanced system privileges, for example to start a docker daemon.

alerts.freeInstanceTitle: The {instanceName} instance can be deployed to either {fra} or {was}
alerts.freeInstanceDescription: Choose a different instance type for other deployment options
alerts.ecoInstancesTitle: The Eco Instances can only be deployed to {fra}, {sin}, and {was}

alerts.noRegionSelectedTitle: At least, one region must be selected
alerts.noRegionSelectedDescription: Select one or more regions to deploy your service
alerts.ecoHasVolumesTitle: Volumes are not supported on Eco instances
alerts.ecoHasVolumesDescription: Select a Standard or GPU instance to keep the volumes attached to your service
alerts.gpuVolumesTitle: GPU Instance can't be changed when volumes are attached
alerts.gpuVolumesDescription: Create a volume from a snapshot and mount it to another service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
alerts.gpuToCpuWithVolumesTitle: CPU Instance can't be changed to a GPU instance when volumes are attached
alerts.gpuToCpuWithVolumesDescription: Create a volume from a snapshot and mount it to another service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>

alerts.noInstanceSelectedDescription: Select an instance to deploy your service
alerts.hobbyPlanTitle: The Hobby plan includes a {instanceName} instance only
alerts.hobbyPlanDescription: Please <upgrade>upgrade your plan</upgrade> to get access to additional instance types
alerts.instanceRequiresUpgradeTitle: The selected instance is available on the {plan} plan
alerts.instanceRequiresUpgradeDescription: You will be asked to upgrade when submitting the form

scaling.fixedDescription: Fixed number of instances in a region regardless of load level
scaling.autoscalingDescription: Automatically adjusted number of instances in the region depending on the load

autoscalingSettings.description: Keep one or more instances running to prevent your service from going idle. To maintain a fixed number of instances in a region, set both the minimum and maximum instances per region to the same value.
autoscalingSettings.scaleToZeroPreview: Scale to zero is currently in preview, check out the <announcement>announcement</announcement>. <feedback>Give feedback?</feedback>
autoscalingSettings.freeInstanceMessage: Free instances are scaled to zero when they are inactive
autoscalingSettings.enableAutoscaling: To enable autoscaling and set scaling criteria, the maximum instances per region must be greater than one
autoscalingSettings.cpuDescription: Autoscale to target {value, number, :: percent} CPU usage on average, per instance
autoscalingSettings.memoryDescription: Autoscale to target {value, number, :: percent} memory usage on average, per instance
autoscalingSettings.requestsLabel: Target number of requests per second
autoscalingSettings.requestsDescription: Autoscale to target {value} requests per second on average, per instance
autoscalingSettings.concurrentRequestsDescription: Autoscale to target {value} concurrent connections, per instance
autoscalingSettings.responseTimeDescription: Autoscale to target a P95 response time of {value}ms or less, per instance
autoscalingSettings.sleepIdleDelayDescription: Number of seconds to wait before sleeping the instance if it receives no traffic
autoscalingSettings.criteriaNotAvailableWithFixedScaling: Scaling criteria are not available with fixed scaling
autoscalingSettings.criteriaNotAvailableWhenMax1: Scaling criteria are not available when the maximum scaling is set to 1
autoscalingSettings.criterionNotAvailableWorker: This criterion is not available for workers

alerts.freeInstanceAlertTitle: Upgrade to another instance type to configure scaling
alerts.freeInstanceAlertDescription: The {instanceName} instance scales down to zero after periods of inactivity. Select any paid instance type to configure scaling.
alerts.ecoInstanceAlertTitle: Services with the {instanceName} instance type cannot be scaled automatically
alerts.ecoInstanceAlertDescription: Select a Standard instance type if you need to set up autoscaling
alerts.noTargetAlertTitle: One scaling criteria must be set
alerts.noTargetAlertDescription: Choose at least 1 criteria and set the value to meet your requirements
alerts.hasVolumesTitle: Scaling settings can't be changed when volumes are attached
alerts.hasVolumesDescription: Detach all the <volumesLink>volumes</volumesLink> from your service if you need to scale. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>

environmentVariables.title: {variables, plural, =0 {No variables} =1 {{variables} variable} other {{variables} variables}}, {files, plural, =0 {no files} =1 {{files} file} other {{files} files}}
environmentVariables.info: Configure manually or drag and drop file with multiple variables
environmentVariables.valueTooltip: You can reference secrets or environment variables (including Koyeb variables) using <documentationLink>interpolation</documentationLink>

bulkEdition.title: Edit multiple variables
bulkEdition.description: Add, delete or edit environment variables
bulkEdition.line1: Paste your environment variables below, one per line with the format key=value. Empty lines and lines starting with # will be ignored.

fileUpload.notPlainText: You must provide a text file
fileUpload.noEnvVars: No environment variables were identified in the provided file

unknownInterpolation.title: Missing interpolation reference
unknownInterpolation.description: The reference "{value}" used in the {type, select, variable {environment variable} file {file} other {type}} {name} does not exist

files.title: Files
files.description: Access content as a file at a specific path

content.label: File content
content.placeholder: Add content, like secrets and variables

ports.titleSinglePort: Port {portNumber} exposed {public, select, true {on {path}} other {to the service mesh}}
ports.titleMultiplePorts: {count, plural, =0 {No ports exposed} other {{count} ports exposed}}
ports.info: Configure the ports and protocols required by your services
ports.pathTooltip: Your service will be publicly accessible at https://[subdomain].koyeb.app{path}. Requests will be sent to the port you selected and load-balanced between your instances.
ports.publicTooltip: If public, the port will be accessible from the Internet. If private, the port will only be accessible to other services running on Koyeb's service mesh.

healthChecks.titleMultipleHealthChecks: {count, plural, =0 {No health checks configured} other {{count} health checks configured}}
healthChecks.expandedTitle: Configure health checks for exposed ports

healthCheck.gracePeriodTooltip: The initial period to wait for the instance to become healthy
healthCheck.restartLimitTooltip: The number of consecutive failures before attempting to restart the instance
healthCheck.timeoutTooltip: The maximum time to wait before considering the check as a failure
healthCheck.httpPathTooltip: The path to perform the HTTP health check
healthCheck.httpMethodTooltip: The HTTP method to use to perform the health check

volumes.title: {count, plural, =0 {No volumes} =1 {{count} volume} other {{count} volumes}} configured
volumes.noDowntimeAlert: Attaching volumes to your service will prevent zero-downtime deployments. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumes.noVolumesAttached: Attach and mount a volume to your service to persist data
volumes.detachVolumeNotSupported: Detaching volumes is not supported yet

createDialog.title: Create volume
createDialog.description: Set the name, size and mount path of your volume

volumesUnavailable.unavailableForInstanceTitle: Volumes are not supported on the {instanceName} instance type
volumesUnavailable.unavailableForInstanceDescription: Select another <instancesLink>instance</instancesLink> in order attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumesUnavailable.multipleInstancesTitle: Volumes are not supported for services deployed with more than one instance or with autoscaling enabled
volumesUnavailable.multipleInstancesDescription: Select fixed <scalingLink>scaling</scalingLink> and one instance in order to attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumesUnavailable.unavailableForRegionDescription: Select another <instancesLink>region</instancesLink> in order attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>
volumesUnavailable.multipleRegionsTitle: Volumes are not supported for services deployed across multiple regions
volumesUnavailable.multipleRegionsDescription: Select a single <instancesLink>region</instancesLink> in order to attach volumes to your service. <documentationLink>Learn more</documentationLink>

serviceName.editServiceNameWarningWeb: If you change the service name, your service will be assigned a new private address on the service mesh. The public URL will remain identical.
serviceName.editServiceNameWarningWorker: If you change the service name, your service will be assigned a new private address on the service mesh.
serviceName.serviceNameTooltip: Give a name to easily identify this service inside your app

welcomeDialog.title: Your 7-day Pro trial just started!
welcomeDialog.description: Try the Koyeb Pro plan free for 7 days and access advanced platform and collaboration features

features.gpu: Deploy intensive applications across GPUs, CPUs, and Accelerators in minutes
features.scaling: Deploy production-grade containers with zero configuration and automatic scaling
features.cpu: Deploy APIs, distributed systems, or blazing-fast inference endpoints worldwide

welcomeDialog.footer: Once the trial period ends for your Koyeb organization, you can continue with the Pro plan or choose another plan that best fits your needs

banner.content: Your Pro trial ends in {days, plural, =1 {{days} day} other {{days} days}}. To maintain access to Pro features, upgrade now.

summaryPopup.timeLeft: {days, plural, =1 {{days} day} other {{days} days}} left in Pro trial

planItem.price: {price} /month {price, select, 0 {+ pay as you go} other {}}

starter.description: For individuals. Pay-per-use, perfect for small apps.
starter.feature1: Generous Free Tier (1x Web Service, 1x Postgres, 5x custom domains)
starter.feature5: Run Inference, APIs, Web Apps, Workers, and Databases

pro.description: Everything in Starter, plus team and support features for production apps

scale.description: Scale your infrastructure, team and support

selectPlan.title: Your Koyeb Pro trial has expired
selectPlan.description: You can easily reactivate your organization by upgrading to a plan
selectPlan.footer: Need more time? <reachOut>Let's chat</reachOut>. You can also continue using our limited Free plan by <downgrade>creating a new organization</downgrade>.

upgrade.title: Your Koyeb Pro trial has expired
upgrade.description: You can easily reactivate your organization by upgrading to a plan

downgrade.title: Downgrade to Free Plan
downgrade.description: To downgrade your account to free plan you need to create a new organization
downgrade.dataLossWarning: All your current services and data will be automatically and permanently removed

footer.message: If you don't want to keep your account, you can <delete>delete it</delete>

main.accountUnderReview: We need more information to approve your account. Please <link>verify your identity</link> to prevent account suspension.
main.sessionTokenWarning: You are currently seeing the organization {organizationName}
main.paymentFailure: We tried to charge your card, but the payment has failed. Please <stripe>update your payment method</stripe> and pay your past due invoices.
main.subscriptionHasPendingUpdate: The provided payment details could not be processed. Please check your payment information in the <stripe>billing portal</stripe> to resolve the issue.

upsell.title: Get the full experience
upsell.description: Upgrade to the Starter plan and get $20 of credit on your first invoice to try the full Koyeb experience
upsell.description.new: Upgrade to the Starter pay-as-you-go plan to access the full Koyeb experience

startForFree.title: Start for free, pay as you grow
startForFree.description: Deploy a service for free and enjoy our simple, predictable, and flexible pricing for all your projects

deploy.title: Deploy in seconds
deploy.description: Deploy your apps from Docker images, or connect your git repositories and simply push to deploy

global.title: Run globally in a click
global.description: Run your apps in one or more of our regions according to your needs. Go global with 255+ edge locations

autoscaling.title: Native autoscaling
autoscaling.description: Enjoy autoscaling with high-end performance thanks to high-frequency CPUs and secure Firecracker microVMs

accountNotFound.title: No Koyeb account is linked to this GitHub profile

accountAlreadyExists.title: A Koyeb account is already linked to this GitHub profile

githubAppInstalled.title: GitHub app installation successful

hobbyPlan.data-transfer: You have reached the outbound data transfer limit for the free database Instance this month. Upgrade to the Starter plan to unlock <link>larger database Instances</link> with unlimited data transfer.

domainsLocked.title: Enable domains
domainsLocked.subTitle: Domains allow you to access your apps using your own domains
domainsLocked.description:
Domains make your apps accessible via your own domain names like www.mydomain.tld or api.example.io.

Upgrade your plan and get started adding your first domain.

home.title: Overview
home.servicesSummary: {web} {web, plural, one {web service} other {web services}}, {worker} {worker, plural, one {worker} other {workers}}, {database} {database, plural, one {database} other {databases}}
home.appTooltip: Apps allow you to group your services together and provide a gateway to expose web services under the same domain

appActions.label: App Actions
appActions.editAppNameWarning: If you change the app name, your app's services will be assigned a new private address on the service mesh. The public URL will not be changed.

deleteAppConfirmationDialog.title: Delete app

joinOrganization.title: What is your organization's name?
joinOrganization.canBeChanged: You can always change it later if you need to
joinOrganization.tooltip: An organization is a space containing all your Koyeb resources that you can use for your own projects or to collaborate as a team. The organization name must be unique and is used to compose your apps public URL. You can change it at any time.

degraded.description: The latest deployment <latestDeploymentLink>{latestDeploymentName}</latestDeploymentLink> did not complete successfully. The service continues to operate with the active deployment <activeDeploymentLink>{activeDeploymentName}</activeDeploymentLink>.

plans.title: Change your organization plan
plans.description: Need more? Upgrade your plan! No commitment, downgrade when you need. Reach out for quota upgrades. For more details about each plan, check out our <pricing>pricing page</pricing>.

starter.name: Starter
starter.description: For individuals. Pay-per-use by the second after the free tier, perfect for small apps.

features.feature6: Run Inference, APIs, Web Apps, Workers, and Databases

pro.name: Pro

unavailable.description: Volumes provide additional, persistent, storage capacity for your services and come in addition to your instances provided ephemeral disk. The Starter plan is required to access the volumes public preview.
